title.native: アンジュ・ヴィエルジュ

description:
The story of the Ange Vierge trading card game follows what happens when "Hairou" portals suddenly open, fusing three different worlds together. As a result, various mysterious "Exceed" powers are awakened in teenaged girls. An academy for these so-called "Progress" girls is built on the isolated Seiran Island in the Pacific.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

title.native: アンジュ・ヴィエルジュ リンケージ

name.native: ブリドカット・セーラ・恵美

node.description:
__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohka_jp) | [Website](http://www.ryohka.jp/)

An illustrator, mostly known for her work on character designs for adult visual novels.

[Website](http://konomi-suzuki.net/) | [Old Blog](http://ameblo.jp/galapa-konomi) | [New Blog](http://ameblo.jp/konomi-suzuki/)

Konomi Suzuki is a Japanese singer from Osaka Prefecture who is signed to Amuleto. After winning the Animax All-Japan Anisong Grand Prix in 2011, she made her debut in 2012 with the release of her first single "Choir Jail", which peaked at 34 on the Oricon charts; the title track of which was used as the opening theme to the anime television series Dusk Maiden of Amnesia. She released her first album 17, in 2014, two albums in 2015, and a further album Lead, in 2016.

Suzuki cites the character Sheryl Nome from Macross Frontier as her inspiration for making music for anime. Her music has been featured in anime series such as The Pet Girl of Sakurasou, No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!, No Game No Life, and Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. She has also performed in events in Japan such as Animelo Summer Live and Animax Musix, and at international events in China, Germany, the United States, and Southeast Asia. In 2018, Suzuki made her voice acting debut, playing the role of Rin in the anime television series Lost Song.

[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mai--ishihara/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jyagamai)

She is a seiyuu affiliated with GadgetLink. She is better known under the alias "Kusuhara Yui" for her adult game voice acting work.

[Profile (VIMS)](http://vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=23) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nojomiy)

**Non-anime roles:**
~!
- Ao in "Akatsuki no Yona" (Drama CD) (Japanese)
- Cosmo Hōjō in "Pretty Rhythm Rainbow Live: Kira Kira My☆Deco Design" (VG) (Japanese)
- Jane in "Granado Espada" (MMORPG) (Japanese)
- Kuu-chan in "Sei Madou Monogatari" (VG) (Japanese)
- Nagisa Shiota in "Ansatsu Kyōshitsu" (VOMIC) (Japanese)
- Nosuri in "Utawarerumono: Itsuwari no Kamen/Futari no Hakuoro" (VG)
- Ricotta in "Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana" (VG) (Japanese)
- Rika Jougasaki in "Granblue Fantasy" (VG) (Japanese)
- Rika Jougasaki in "THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER 005: Rika Jougasaki" (Music/Drama CD) (Japanese)
- Yukimura Kusunoki in "Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai" (drama CD) (Japanese)!~

__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Website](https://taka8rie.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=236) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/taka8rie/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/taka8rie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/riery_syame/) | [YouTube](https://m.youtube.com/channel/UC9xUIUtv3pyt_s_LtCLWP_Q) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Takahashi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E6%9D%8E%E4%BE%9D)

A voice actress and singer. She won a Best Female Newcomer Award at the 10th Seiyuu Awards in 2016.

She is part of the idol group [Earphones](https://anilist.co/staff/195973/) with fellow voice actresses [Marika Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/119383) and [Yuki Nagaku](https://anilist.co/staff/119370), originally formed for the anime [Sore ga Seiyuu!](https://anilist.co/anime/21009).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Hu Tao](https://anilist.co/character/233425/) - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
- [Hikari](https://anilist.co/character/3966/Hikari) - Pokémon Masters EX (Video Game)
- Benten - Soul Tide (Video Game)
- Huma - Tower of Fantasy (Video Game)
- Diesel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (Video Game)
- Erina - Persona 5 Tactica (Video Game)
- Ren - Date a Live: Ren Dystopia (Video Game)
- Kokona - Strinova (Video Game)
- Perfumer - Arknights (Video Game)

An illustrator who works primarily for KeroQ and Makura.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kilacco)
